value.name: Poverty Headcount ($1.90 a day)
value.description: The poverty headcount index measures the proportion of the population with daily per capita income (in 2011 PPP) below the poverty line.

value.name: Poverty Headcount ($2.50 a day)
value.description: The poverty headcount index measures the proportion of the population with daily per capita income (in 2005 PPP) below the poverty line.

value.name: Middle Class ($10-50 a day) Headcount
value.description: The poverty headcount index measures the proportion of the population with daily per capita income (in 2005 PPP) below the poverty line.

value.name: Official Moderate Poverty Rate-National
value.description: The poverty headcount index measures the proportion of the population with daily per capita income below the official poverty line developed by each country.

value.name: Poverty Headcount ($4 a day)
value.description: The poverty headcount index measures the proportion of the population with daily per capita income (in 2005 PPP) below the poverty line.

value.name: Vulnerable ($4-10 a day) Headcount
value.description: The poverty headcount index measures the proportion of the population with daily per capita income (in 2005 PPP) below the poverty line.

value.name: Poverty Gap ($1.90 a day)
value.description: The poverty gap captures the mean aggregate income or consumption shortfall relative to the poverty line across the entire population. It measures the total resources needed to bring all the poor to the level of the poverty line (averaged over the total population).

value.name: Poverty Gap ($2.50 a day)
value.description: The poverty gap captures the mean aggregate income or consumption shortfall relative to the poverty line across the entire population. It measures the total resources needed to bring all the poor to the level of the poverty line (averaged over the total population).

value.name: Poverty Gap ($4 a day)
value.description: The poverty gap captures the mean aggregate income or consumption shortfall relative to the poverty line across the entire population. It measures the total resources needed to bring all the poor to the level of the poverty line (averaged over the total population).

value.name: Poverty Severity ($1.90 a day)
value.description: The poverty severity index combines information on both poverty and inequality among the poor by averaging the squares of the poverty gaps relative the poverty line

value.name: Poverty Severity ($2.50 a day)
value.description: The poverty severity index combines information on both poverty and inequality among the poor by averaging the squares of the poverty gaps relative the poverty line

value.name: Poverty Severity ($4 a day)
value.description: The poverty severity index combines information on both poverty and inequality among the poor by averaging the squares of the poverty gaps relative the poverty line

value.name: Access to electricity (% of total population)
value.description: Access to electricity is the percentage of population with access to electricity.

value.name: Total final energy consumption (TFEC)
value.description: Total final energy consumption (TFEC): This indicator is derived form energy balances statistics and is equivalent to total final consumption excluding non-energy use.

value.name: Literacy rate, youth total (% of people ages 15-24)
value.description: The number of persons aged 15 to 24 years who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life, divided by the population in that age group. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. For further country-specific definition details please refer to the source of information, the UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS): www.uis.unesco.org
